content.user_title: Apply web styling patterns to React components
content.value_statement: Creating consistent and responsive styles for React applications requires understanding multiple CSS approaches. This skill provides ready-to-use patterns for Tailwind CSS, CSS Modules, and component variants that improve development speed.
actual_capabilities: Generate Tailwind CSS class combinations with variants
Create conditional class names using clsx and tailwind-merge
Implement responsive breakpoints and dark mode
Apply CSS Modules patterns for component isolation
Add animations with Tailwind and Framer Motion
limitations: Does not modify actual CSS files or configuration
Does not generate complete styling systems from scratch
Does not validate CSS syntax or catch errors
Does not integrate with build tools or compilers

best_practices: Use clsx or tailwind-merge to handle conditional class combinations and prevent duplicate styles
Define component variants with class-variance-authority for type-safe and maintainable component APIs
Use mobile-first responsive breakpoints starting with base styles, then overriding at sm, md, lg, xl breakpoints
anti_patterns: Avoid hardcoding class strings without using tailwind-merge, which can lead to conflicting styles
Do not use arbitrary values extensively without extracting them to theme configuration for consistency
Avoid mixing Tailwind classes with inline styles, which makes the codebase harder to maintain

faq.question: Which CSS approach works best for my project?
faq.answer: Tailwind CSS suits projects needing rapid iteration and customization. CSS Modules works well for component isolation without external dependencies.

faq.question: How many breakpoint variants should I define?
faq.answer: Start with mobile-first base styles. Add sm, md, and lg breakpoints. Add xl or 2xl only if large screens need different layouts.

faq.question: Can I use multiple styling approaches together?
faq.answer: Yes, combine Tailwind for utility classes with CSS Modules for component-specific styles or with styled-components for dynamic theming.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only generates code patterns. It reads no files, makes no network requests, and stores no user data.

faq.question: Why are my Tailwind classes not applying?
faq.answer: Check that your content paths include your component files in tailwind.config.js and that styles are imported correctly in your application.

faq.question: How does this compare to CSS-in-JS libraries?
faq.answer: Tailwind provides utility classes for rapid prototyping. CSS Modules offers component-scoped styles. styled-components excels at dynamic, theme-based styling.
